review: TGIF is a standard chain restaurant.  We've all been there.  We all love it and we all hate it.  Here are some of my reasons: Love: The Jack Daniels Burger.  Oh My.  The sauce on this burger is amazing.  It's sweet and smooth and taste so good on not only the burger but the sweet potato fries. Love: The Service.  It's usually pretty good.  Waiters rock red and white striped shirts and are generally friendly and energetic. Hate: The Sound.  It. Is. Soooooooo. Loud. In. There.  Why?  Because the designer of this particular location decided it would be a good idea to put tile on the floor, and tin on the ceiling.  Sound bounces around the place like crazy.   Go.  Eat.  But if you're looking to have a real conversation request to sit in one of the side dining rooms.

Reasons to TGIF: - The food is tasty (anything fried or smothered in jack daniels sauce is gonna be good) - The food is cheap (and when you have to feed a few people on a budget, chain restaurants know how to get it done) - It's fun for kids (you don't have to worry about the kids being too loud - the sound of the blender will actually drown out their joyful noises) - The drinks are affordable (beer that is....the sugar packed mixed drinks are just as much as anywhere else) I had a good time here with friends with little ones - you really can't beat the atmosphere and prices for a family night out!

Don't come here.   The service is pretty horrendous.  It took thirty minutes to get water, forty minutes to get two salads.  Ridiculous. I'm pretty sympathetic when it comes to restaurants and the wait staff, as we all know they deal with some of the most unruly of patrons.  But that is not excuse for the attitude that I received right upon sitting down. The waitress I had was extremely rude; and seemed entirely bothered by my presence.  She was far more interested in her friends that sat in a booth near our table. We were largely ignored, not given any courteous service, and had to wait ridiculously long for everything - EVEN WATER.  Now, I realize the 'kitchen' gets packed, but WATER is ALL THE WAITRESS.  The food came out late and cold, so it was pretty clear that this woman wasn't doing her job. Positives: - Nothing.  Food probably would've been good, had it not cooled on a damn window sill while our waitress passed pleasantries with her loud and annoying pack of morons. Negatives: - Gets extremely packed, so be prepared to wait for your seat for an extremely long time. - Horrible service.  This absolute WORST I've ever had to deal with in my life. - Prices for drinks are pretty horrendous. The space Yelp allows me does not give me enough to express how displeased I am with this place.  I will never go back.

Our server was really good until later on when he was assigned to another section of the restaurant which I was pretty annoyed about, but still he made a good effort to make us happy. Overall service at this particular Friday's needs improvement especially since it wasn't even busy that day since we got there early in the afternoon. Food is your typical Friday fare, they have drink & appetizer specials however you must dine at the bar which I thought they could've been a bit lenient about since I was literally in a booth next to the bar.

A nice TGIF location. We came here once one Friday during happy hour with a group of people to hang out and chill.  There wasn't too many people there a the time (around 6ish) and we sat in the bar. It was a nice TGIF; clean, cool, with crimson walls and booths, and with less crap on the wall compared to other TGIFs.  The bar was a big square and we all fit in to sides of the bar that formed a right angle. It was a good seating arrangement since we could all see each other and talk to each other without craning our necks. My bf and I took advantage of their Happy Hour deals: Half priced appetizers and $2 to $5 on select drink specials (ask the bartender which drinks are included in the happy hour special). The bartender was nice and pleasant, and we receive our orders without having to wait a long time. Food was good, drinks weren't too watered down, and overall we had an enjoyable time.

I've been to way too many TGI Friday's and normally don't mind the food there. However, I'll try to completely avoid this location. The wait to get in was long. Their waiting area is tiny, so it was crowded like a night club by the entrance. Someone should have turned on the music louder. After a long wait, we sit. Service is super slow. Finally ordered my TGI Friday's usual (Cajun Chicken and Shrimp), and it was terrible. I didn't even finish half of it. It tasted really bad. Although this location is bigger than the others, it's not worth the trip here. The food and service is one of the worst around.
One step up from Fast Food.  Everything came out as requested.  No significant issues.  Forgettable.

Even one star is one too many.  Worst TGI Friday's I've ever eaten in.  Food would have been OK if it didn't  come to the table cold.  Sent back the hamburger to be redone and it came back microwaved with a soggy roll.  Waiter denied that it was microwaved.  Table was dirty when we sat down.  No silverware was placed on the table.  I had to corral a passing staffer who was bringing out some silverware.  Waiter was completely inattentive and kept on disappearing.  Finally we were waiting such a long time for our check that we got up and asked the hostess for our bill.  Someone had to go looking for the waiter.  He finally showed up as we were about to walk out and handed me the bill.  For the first time ever, I paid the bill and did not tip.  This was the absolute worst experience ever and I will never return.  Obviously the management is clueless if they allow the restaurant to operate this way.

TGIF is just that...A thank God it's Friday place.  After going to Chills and Grand Lux nearby for so many years, it was so nice to get back to Friday's. i was so pleased with he drinks and my food for a commercial chain.  I decided to go here last friday with my co-worker and best friend and we had a great time. the service was excellent and the drinks were off the chain! Please do yourself a favor and and give yourself a TGIF!

It's Fridays...Pros...Their $10 meal deal which included Appi and Entree and $16 for Appi, Entree, and dessert. Pretty good overall. The Bad...Service is always lacking and weekends is always packed. Oh and there are some shady people that come to this location. Yea you know the types. We saw a group of 4 shady types eat a whole meal with drinks and skip out on the bill because of how busy they were. This kinda thing shouldn't happen but you can't pick and choose who gets to come into your restaurant unfortunately.

I often frequent this TGI Friday's.  The food is usually fresh (there was one instance where it wasnt so good) and the wait is usually minimal.  I often sit at the bar due to the late night bar specials which include food and drink specials.  The bartenders are not exactly the most attentive people, however.  I can sit there for more than 15 minutes before getting their attention, even if they are not that busy.  If you are a Stripes member there are great benefits so make sure to put in for your credit.

I absolutely hated the atmosphere, food, and beer here. The menus are dirty. It takes forever to order a drink. The beer tasted like they haven't cleaned the drift beer lines for a while. The class of people were loud and obnoxious. Never going back.

Good location for a Fridays. Huge and a fun place to hang out. Besides that the food was not good at all. I order some sort of hamburger which tasted reheated and my girlfriend ordered a salad which were simple pieces of lettuce with cold chicken on top.  One last thing I had to interrupt the conversation the hostes was having with the staff in order for us to get seated.

I'm a regular dine in guest but last night I order Togo and it was horrible I order the spinach dip and it looked like they didn't have any more left and gave me someone's left over. Bad Togo experience

Meh,,,its Fridays's,,,nothing special and we only went here because it was late,,,,i felt bad even being there at 11pm since im in the business and i know how annoying late night tables usually are,,,,but my god the first thing i notice was there were two tables near us that both had little babies at them,,,it was 11pm at night why the hell do you have your poor kid out and bouncing off the walls of a restaurant,,,,and i mean one was maybe 2 the other maybe 3,,,,put your kids in bed you crappy parents,,,,anyway,,,our server was tired,,,,i felt so bad for him he wasn't happy,,,,we didn't get one of our appetizers we ordered but we got the pretzels, pot stickers and steak. It was all decent and we were in and out in under an hour because like i said i wanted to get in and out quick,,,,when we left the toddlers were still there,,,,good job parents of the year trashbags,,,,

I never complained ever about a TGIF, this one sucks. The soda was flat, our food was nasty and didn't have flavor. The servers don't even care about you, and only have a smile on their face when it's time for you to pay.

So took my little baby boy to TGIF's and had a sweet lunch.  I had to make it quick cause he wasn't feeling well so we just had a kids meal and appitizers.  The Pretzel Bread app was DELICIOUS!!!  The dipping sauce was alright, but the bread itself was AWESOME!!  My 18 month old loved it!!!  He kept saying "bed mama, bed" translation "bread" - lol!!  Our server was nice and quick with service, which was perfect when dining with a toddler.  Great lunch overall!!
Good food but i wasnt crazy about fridays having a dj, it was too loud and didnt enjoy the experience. If you like a restaurant with a bar/club atmosphere then thus is the place for you.
so disappointed! I wish TGI Friday would give me a great experience but it didn't.

First time back in over a year. Better service, food, drinks, atmosphere.  Decent beer selection, with some seasonals and locals available. Nice range on appetizers and the menu. Better than the other similar restaurants in the area.

Ehhhh.... The food not so good got the spicy beef cheese dip it was lukewarm, got the Jack Daniels Chicken and Cajan Shrimp the shrimp was not Cajan and the chicken was very dry.. Got moved 3 times! The service was good and friendly.... I would recommend coming for drinks only.

Service is beyond slow; two hours before appetizers and it's empty. Steak was sub-par and came out cold. Friends chicken pasta had chicken strips that were paper thin with no flavor. We had to on multiple occasions seek out another waiter to get service and have our plates cleared. Absolutely awful.
Good deals. Our waiter Bryan K was terrific!  Nice size booths, tasty food and good friends. Come down: they have good deals every night of the week!

Just returned from dinner at the Westbury NY TGI Fridays. We are Stripes card holders and usually enjoy our meals here. Today I changed things up and got a 10 ounce sirloin steak. My steak was really good. I ordered it medium well and it came out as advertised. My wife ordered a Ruben and my son had a hamburger. There were no left overs which is unusual. Using the buy one get one entree free, the bill was pleasant as well. Our waiter Patrick was very attentive and professional.  Thanks for a really nice experience TGI Fridays!!!

In a sea of chains, Friday's was one of the first. Every location was constantly mobbed with long waits. I remember begging my parents to go to Fridays.  Nowadays, it is an entirely different experience.  Visited this location last week with a few buddies of mine after the hockey game. We sat in the bar area, as we recalled the "half off appetizers" deal they had. Unfortunately, now, you only get that deal if you are physically sitting at the bar. The waiter left, and began visiting us every 2-3 minutes to take our order. Overbearing is the word I would use to describe it.  When we ordered, the "food" we received was poor in every sense of the word.  -Wings: Tiny, dry, lacking any meat, clearly frozen -Pretzel sticks with dipping cheese: The "pretzel sticks" tasted like nothing more than breadsticks with salt on them, and the "dipping cheese" was disgusting, it tasted like velveeta, pathetic;  -Mozzarella sticks: hard to mess up right? Wrong! Tasteless, with solid cheese inside, couldn't even melt the cheese!   Arguably, these items are not hard to do well, however, everything tasted as if it was taken directly from the freezer, and thrown into a fryer without a care as to its preparation. I understand its a chain, and that it is not expensive food, but COME ON! The manager and/or owners of Fridays should visit the cheesecake factory, because their food is quality and has great taste. Frankly, the food at Fridays was disgusting, I will probably never return to a Fridays.

This review is for the to go part of the restaurant.  I picked up my order at the bar.  Partly my fault for not checking to make sure That they gave me everything but it was a large order....  I get home and realize they left out 2 burgers from the take out.  I go back to the store, it's now been 45 min since I went there to pick it up.  Everything is crazy there, I had to tell 3 different people that they left out the burgers.  Someone comes and gives me coupons for an appetizer ....I would rather a credit towards my bill and have the tip I left back.  They proceed to give me the two burgers that were left....this is now an hour after the burgers were made.  I tell them that they shouldn't be giving me these cold burgers, meanwhile all the other food I ordered is now at home getting cold.  It takes another 20 min. To get the burgers and I had to ask them again where are the burgers in order to have someone go back and get them.  I get home with the burgers and one of them wasn't correct with the toppings.  I would never go back, someone requested Fridays which is why I ordered from there but I should have known better, they are just awful.

First of all, I want to say that I did NOT come here on a Friday, if that makes any difference. Despite all the low reviews, I decided to give this place a try since it has been a while since I've had TGIF food. I was pleasantly surprised. The inside of this branch had a huge space and comfortable seating. The service was excellent as the waitress came by to check on things multiple times throughout the meal. Food wise, I had the bacon mac and cheese bites which was AMAZING. The Jack Daniels ribs and various appetizers were great too. For dessert, the Tennessee whiskey cake was absolutely delicious!!
Of all the Fridays I've been to I like this one best. The staff is always very friendly and attentive. The food comes out quick and its hot and fresh.

This is my boyfriends favorite after work/late night dinner go-to spot. To me, it's probably one of the lower end commercial restaurants that I've been to.  They never get my order right. My steak is ALWAYS medium/medium well when I ask for medium rare and the last time I went, my steak was burnt and bitter. Our waitress was brand new and was never around. But it's a Fridays. What can you really expect.  I've definitely had better but then again I've also had worse.

Tonight was the night where we wanted to kick back and be ready to unzip your pants;-) to make room for desserts....But Our Waiter Alex got our Drift just keep bringing the food out no need to wait on is to finish a plate cause we was dipping from east to west to south to north;-)...But The Spot clean well kept clean even and its always good to see some rerun play-off if you a b.ball head like me while chowing down;-). .. Everything was SCRUMPTIOUS til every drop..aka will be back:-D:-;-);-)

I never have any issues when I come to this location. From the host to the waiters, everyone is extremely sweet and helpful. They always make me feel that they are happy that I came in. I love that feeling. It's makes me feel welcome and I always end up coming back.  I had the Jack Daniel's Sampler & Pot Stickers. The sampler came with Crispy Cajun Shrimp, half rack of Jack Daniel's glazed baby back Pork Ribs & Asian inspired Sesame Jack Chicken Strips with a side of Jack Daniel's sauce. The Pot Stickers are pan seared Pork Dumplings served with Szechwan dipping sauce. It's soooo good!! On Thursdays they have certain specials. I had a Long Island for $3.

Literally the worst Fridays I have ever been to.  A group of 4 of us stopped by on a Saturday night before heading to see Godzilla. The hostess told us the wait would be 20 minutes which for how busy it was didn't seem that bad. About 15 minutes later another party of 4 walked through the door and I went to follow to see how long their wait time would be. But, they didn't have one. They were seated right away, and when I asked when we were to be seated she said another 10 minutes. She told every single group of people that their wait time would be 20 minutes. It was vague and poorly handled and she was rude. They didn't have a proper system and no pagers were given. Finally when we were brought to our table I saw at least 6 empty tables on the way to ours. Empty tables on a Saturday night with at least 10 parties waiting to be seated? Bad move. At least 3 of those tables were dirty during our entirety in the restaurant. We ordered quickly since we waited so long (at least half an hour) and waited again. Drinks took at least 10 minutes to hit the table. 2 of us ordered Margaritas which were surprisingly good. One ordered a 22oz angry orchard, which he enjoyed, and then my fiancé ordered coffee. But, of course, not before getting mocked by our douchey waiter! I bet making jokes at your customers expense will help you pocket a solid tip, buddy.  Food was pretty good and it came our relatively quick. We ordered two 3 for alls and two of the new sharing appetizers. Nothing to write home about but we were satisfied. New bacon mac and cheese balls were really good and I liked the pretzels with beer cheese.  But, yet again service was crap. Our waiter did not bring our food out. So we were separating dishes and the waitress got pissed she had to hold the plate for more than a second and put them down on the table and told us "to figure it out ourselves." We saw our waiter once during our entire visit. We had to ask 2 separate servers for our check since he was MIA.  The management should really get their act together because every employee we came in contact with was incapable and rude. I'd never visit this location again.

This location is like any other TGI Friday's: decent food, spacious but crowded and a bit rowdy, lots of kids running about, and TVs all switched to sports or news stations. When you're in the mood for the usual American fare (hamburgers, basic pastas, chicken fingers, etc.), this is a nice place to go to. I'd highly recommend the pretzels/cheese dip and the chips/spinach dip appetizers. The JD burger and shrimp/chicken pasta are good too. Portion sizes are more than large enough to fill you up. The staff are always very attentive, helpful, and welcoming (sometimes overly chipper). Food: 3/5 -- good Service: 4/5 -- overly attentive at times Atmosphere: 3/5 -- neat and spacious but crowded and loud Overall: 3/5 -- good

Terrible service. Server name was Daniel Dow. Started by asking us to repeat our order 3 times while he was spaced out while we're talking. Then he rudely comes over and says "oh you guys aren't even gonna order beer or margaritas?" Comes back with the appetizer plates and slams them down on the table and process to walk away without a word. When we let him know that one of the plates were cracked, he just picks it up and walks away without a word. In the end I asked the manager to changed our server but about 5 minutes later the original server comes out with the apps and starts to toss and slide them across the table as if we were dogs. We had enough and just walked out. Never going back.
Pretty nice place for a Sunday dinner, good service and the food is good for the price you pay, I've been here about three times..always had a great time.

Hands down worst dining experience of my life. Waited 35 min to just order a drink. They forgot to order half of our meals. After complaining to manager he's seemed to not have a care in the world. I will never go back to this Fridays again.

This Friday's gets three stars for food and an extra star for our server Dave. He was funny, attentive, perfect in all ways. I had my Friday's stripes card on the table and he spotted it right away, bringing us fresh chips and salsa. We didn't order a lot but he treated us as if we were royalty. My friend and I got cokes and split the three for all appetizer plate. We had traditional buffalo wings, mozzarella sticks, and potstickers. The wings were good but not terribly meaty. The sticks were very tasty and not greasy. The potstickers were particularly good. There was a sauce provided for each part of the meal. My only complaint is that all the sauces blended on the small serving plates we were given, which gave some weird flavor combinations. In addition to the outstanding service, a manager came and checked on us during and after the meal. I will definitely be back and hope I am lucky enough to have Dave as the server.

Weekends are crazy here so don't go late with 3 or more people or you will be piss. The host and waiters are very polite and well trained. The service was fast, and the food good. Its not the most fabulous place but overall it's a great place to have a good, cheap, quick meal or have a drink with your friends.

This Friday's is much like all the other locations.  We usually sit at the bar for drinks and apps after work.  The service is decent and it's reasonably clean. There are a lot of kids, so it gets noisy.

p.s. I went to the Manhasset Fridays a few times the past two years, and it's not bad: but still nothing to touch how good the old Westbury Fridays was years ago, but it's solid enough, though the service at the Manhasset location, and seating strategies/availability, and a few other things, are kinda lacking. The food is decent enough.  I don't like either enough to really give them any major great reviews.   In a pinch, they're fine.  I find the staff are friendly, mainly, but the service even at slower times is just, slow and sometimes with a lack of inter-staff communication.  The food is decent, and it seems like, at least, they run a clean restaurant and it's reliable for what/where it is. And gosh it's a bump-up from IHOP!
Super slow...floors very dirty food and crayons and papers ....unattentive servers and its not busy at all
One of my favorite bartender is Ruben knowledge on drinks & food. Always come here for happy hour at the bar Wednesday & Thursday  $3 drinks & 1/2 off Apps.

Do not come here for lunch!!! Slow service!!! Should have listened when the couple next us got up and left  they after waiting 20 minutes for a waiter. The hostess is horrible.. I asked if we could move because we were sitting near the window were it was freezing. She wouldn't move us. Meanwhile the place was so empty. The food was terrible.  They tried to pass off the things we got as the things we ordered. Terrible!!!

This Fridays is pretty much like all the other locations. I went for lunch before hitting the mall and we had to wait like 15 mins to be seated even thou the place was empty. Once seated, we had to wait another 15 mins to get our orders and almost 30 mins for the food to come! I was wondering if they were killing the cow or chicken who knows! Not good customer service! Food: like any other chain restaurant it was good. I had the Jack Daniels sampler and it was yummy!  Place: its very clean, family oriented, not too many drunkies at the bar Drinks: water down but still are decent.

Terrible !  My family and I have eaten here for many years and have always loved it. Infact my husband worked here as a teen. Ever since management has changed the place had gone from great to crapy! We get seated and I almost break my neck slipping on a wet floor, when I called a waitress over she literally said "ohhhh ok" I was left feeling like my near fall was not of any importance to her at all.  Then ordered my wings like I have for the past 10 years , light on the sauce extra blue cheese. The waitress comes back with the wettest wings so I sent them back of course. I even asked her if she heard me and she said yes and yet she came to me with these wet wings.  So I'm now so done with this particular location and will be spreading the word to  all my friends who eat there as well how terrible this place has become.

If there was anyway to give less than one star I would. I took my two daughters there for lunch. The wait to get a table was not that long, but once we sat down, no one came over. After what had to be like ten minutes, I started timing. Ten more minutes went by with nothing. At this point we made the hostesses aware of it. Ten more minutes we got up and walked out. Unbelievable. Thirty minutes plus the wait to get seated in the first place and we had to leave to start again somewhere else. Thankfully we were eating chips at Cozymels with in 10 minutes with drinks and our orders taken.  I wrote them an email and have yet to receive a response.

I'm typically not a huge fan of chain restaurants, however, I barely dine on LI and sometimes you are HANGRY enough that you need to just pick something quick, instead of finding something delicious to eat. We ended up here after bickering over where to go. They remodeled this location and now it appears to be more spacious, with even more seating.  It was a Thursday so it wasn't that crowded. We had a huge round table to ourselves with a full view of the TVs situated at the bar. Our waitress took forever to get our drink orders and then even longer to get our food order. The food is surprisingly decent. Every item has the calories listed next to it and since it wasn't a cheat day for me, I had to pay attention to those. Several of their options are calorie-friendly and come in at under 600 cals. This is better than places like Applebee's, which only offer a handful of items under 1,000 cals. I went with the chicken and shrimp. The chicken was good and tender, the shrimp was full of flavor, and the sauce on the side was actually pretty good. Overall, it's a quick and decent place if you're in the land of chain restaurants (this area close to Roosevelt Field only seems to have chains) and you're hungry. Service is absolutely horrendous (took 20 mins between handing over c/c and getting the receipt to sign) but like I said, if you're stuck in the area and your blood sugar be droppin', pop by.

Came here with friends on Valentine's Day (which was a Saturday night this year) and even though they were very busy they were very accommodating.  They had a half price bottle of wine special that we took advantage of, and we had a couple of rewards coupons, and we needed to be out in an hour for a movie. We all enjoyed our food (and the wine! Ecco Domani).  The menu has changed since my last visit, and I had a healthier option  (the calories are listed on the menu - very important if you go to a place like this and want to watch what you eat). The SIZZLING SIRLOIN* & SPINACH was delicious and a good portion for under 500 calories.  I requested medium-rare (the steak was probably more medium, but I expect it to be slightly over when I order from a chain restaurant). The steak was delicious and so were the veggies.
Just checked my credit card bill and the bill was not fixed! We were charged the full price for the bottle that was supposed to be half off! Will be calling!

This Friday's used to be really good.  Last time I went the waiter NEVER came back.  Our food also took forever to come.  The manager had finally passed by and we grabbed their attention.  But then she only came back to give us our food and we never saw her again.  We were there for at least 1 1/2 hours before we got our check.  Wish it was as good as it used to be but sorry to say it isn't.
Adam was my server and he was amazing! I had a great experience! The food was good and the service was so great! He makes me want to return! Hes an actor who server for extra money and hes amazing!!!

This place is hit or miss. Sometimes the foods great service is crap and vice versa. Today I ordered a "house-made" lemonade. Shit was minute made! Def a miss there! Overall....depends on the time and day you choose to come here. I'm definitely a fan of the jack daniels line up so for that I will keep coming back and for the brownie obsession.

We come here for the endless appetizers ($12) deal. Is it worth it? The portions are not smaller than the regular appetizers found at chains similar to these, so no you will not leave this place hungry trust me. There is a list of selected items for this deal so there is plenty of variety to chose from and not feel like you being shafted on choices. It is a convenient bargain for when you are looking to fill your belly but you are not quite prepared for a sit down meal. Depending on what day you go there are also drink specials. On Wednesdays it is mudslides ($3) and they are amazing!! I would say among my favorite apps are the pan seared dumplings, the spicy chicken tostadas (careful, they have a kick to them), and the jack daniels boneless wings. Not a fan of the garlic bruschetta because it was very heavy on the garlic or the mac-n-cheesy bites just not cheesy at all. If you are looking for a quick sit down meal the burgers here are also good but feel free to explore your options.

Cinco  De  Mayo. Stopped by for a quick lunch special  Definitely  enjoyed my pick 2 $6.99. Order house salad and BLT  with avacado. Beverage was Blueberry Pomegranate long island  ice tea. Excellent  blends to infused  the pallet. Order-to-go from their lunch special: Parmcrusted chicken., mac n cheese salad.

So let me preface this by saying I absolutely love TGI Friday's.  Today I had the worst experience at this TGI Friday's I have ever had. My waiter must have been new or nervous or not suited to the food service industry. I'm not really sure what the deal is.  He was a nice enough guy and started out strong by repeating our orders back to us. It was quite a bit of time between request and fulfilment. But I'm not a monster and I can understand being busy. I really lost all patients when the food, which was repeated and corrected, came back all wrong. It was so bad my daughter had to watch everybody eat while waiting on them to make her entree from the beginning. Not to mention all the different sides that came to the table that we had to send back. He did try to make it up and bring her some fries. Which was nice, but....... When her food finally came and she asked for some condiments, they took FOREVER to come. Like really!!!!! My daughter took it upon herself to ask the hostess for a manager. No management came. We had a ToGo order that we gave to the server at the beginning of our entree orders and specifically let him know it was a ToGo order. When we were asking for the ToGo boxes and ready to leave, my husband inquired about the ToGo meal and the server went to put it in. LIKE REALLY!!!! My husband asked for a manager a second time and we were able to finally speak to a manager who comped some of the food and was very apologetic. I will come back but I will try some of the other restaurants in the area and give TGIF a break.

First time I've been to this specific location in Westbury.  I have to say, it was a fantastic environment considering the Rangers game and basketball playoffs were on.  The service was great and even the restaurant manager asked my party about preferences in seating location and game preference which I appreciated.  I would highly recommend going to this TGIF, no complaints.  Additionally, food  and drinks came fast and tasted great!  Recommend it for everyone! Great staff and restaurant!

I came here with my little cousin after her dance recital for a quick celebration. I have been to many TGIF'S including this one in the past. However, this visit was quite unpleasant.  The service was bad, that's the easiest way to put it. Took 20 minutes to take our drink order and then another 10 felon appetizers. The appetizers came out before our drinks and then our drinks came out with our entrees. The waitresses were too busy walking around chatting with each other and bragging about their beauty rather than doing their jobs.  When the food came out our orders were wrong and there was something disgusting in one of our salads and it had to be sent back.  The food took so long to come out that when it did everything was cold & there is nothing that I hate more than cold sweet potatoes fries.  I won't personally go back to this location. The only thing that came by quickly was the check.

I have been to this Friday's but never had an experience like this. Walked in to the lobby and there was not hostess so we entered the main doors to the restaurant and found the hostess watching tv. She seemed surprised we walked in and said "oh! Let me get you some menus!" She then tried to sit us at a table with dirty seats so we asked to move down two tables. A waiter came over and took our drink order, then a second waitress came and took our order again saying that the original server had been cut, however we saw him the entire time we were there. Took a while to get our drinks and a while to get our food. All our food was warm, not hot and very unappetizing.  We mentioned it to our waitress and she ignored the comment and asked if we wanted more water. No apology. We got the check pretty quickly, with no comments she just dropped it on the table. Probably won't come back.

My wife & I and my mother in law came in to TGI Fridays on Saturday afternoon around 230. Overall I'd say everything was good. The hostess stand area smells like cigarettes for whatever reason but other than that the service is very good and fast. I found the food to be tasty and enjoyable. Our waitress name was Tina and she was very good. I would suggest putting better lighting in the bathroom just because that's something I like when I'm in a public restaurant. Long Island iced tea I had was ok I wish it was a little stronger but I guess that's me. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody. And I would return here.

TGI Fridays..  It's a chain. The food is almost always exactly the same. I'm really not a big fan on chains (except Chipotle), however the Jack Daniel's burger is always pretty awesome. Service at this one is alright from my experience. But yeah, typical "Friday's" experience.

You know what you get at Fridays so this review will be like most I guess.  The food is OK, just decent enough to not be bad.  The beer surprisingly is above average, especially now that this one has added some great Port Jeff beers.  The star of this place is the staff, we sat at the bar and were well taken care of. I would go back for drinks anytime.  A decent place to grab some suds and a bite to eat if you are in the area.

This used to be a great spot to eat and watch the game. Not very happy with the service or cold food.  Ambience: chain/ hip/ it's TIFG. It's nice.  Bathrooms: filthy.  Food: the food was in taste, but was cold. Service: my food was cold. The servers / runners looked like they were forced to be here, no one smiles EXCEPT the hostess. The waiter was obviously very over worked and my wings came out cold- sent them back, cold again. The 2 separate tables from us they gave the wrong food. The waiter.... where was he. He was honestly very nice but way over worked.  This really sucks because the Roosevelt field mall food court "dining district" was just redone and I could have ate there and been much happier- instead I went to TGIF and I regret it. Would I come back? Probably not anytime soon.  Would I recommend this place? No. Go Applebee's or many other choices around. Update: the kitchen manager came over and was pretty nice. He apologized for the food being cold twice and gave us a discount on the check. We didn't complain for a discount- we weren't looking for a discount just some acknowledgement but it was nice of him.

Friday's is like the McDonald's of restaurants. This place is pretty much my #1 go-to spot whenever I'm hungry or just want to get some drinks. They do have decent drinks and there are usually a few specials going especially if you sit in the bar area.  This Westbury location is like the best location on Long Island. It's in the best area around the mall and there's usually never a dull moment in here.  I don't think I've ever had like a really horrible food experience here. However, most things taste microwaved or overcooked. It has to be that Jack Daniels sauce that keeps me coming back. I swear anything that sauce touches tastes 10x better than it did without it.  Download the Friday's app & sign up so you can accumulate points. With the points you get free meals, apps or whatever you choose.

yes endless appetizers are a good deal but not when they are pretty crappy. I started out with ahi tuna crisps and it had a good amount of tuna and guacamole but it was way too spicy for me. There was a slice of jalapeño on top which completely burned my mouth and I had to take it off all of my pieces. My bf ordered mozzarella sticks and they were completely hollow. Then I ordered boneless wings the spicy korean flavor and those were way too salty and didn't taste good at all. I should have gone with my gut and ordered an entree. Maybe next time if I do go there I will.  The service was fine. Our waitress was helpful.  The appetizers need improvement.

Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. It took ten 10 minutes for the server to greet us. He did not know the menu whatsoever. Soda machine didn't work. Once we ordered he came back ten minutes later to tell us they were out of one of the entrees. We still didn't get out drinks. We got up and left. Will never go back there.

One of my favorite places to go when I can't figure out what's for dinner or where to go out with a friend to chat. The bartenders and wait staff are always really nice and on their job. The food is always good and gets better and better every time I come. I have the app which makes coming here that much better.  One of my favorite locations hands down. Tip your bartenders generously, they definitely work hard for it. ;-)
Wait staff smells. Also a tad rude. Apps are tight. Especially the endless. Drinks: watered down.

Visit Date: December 26, 2015 Came here the day after Christmas with my friends who were visiting from Colorado and my best friend. I had to be healthy so I ordered the harvest salad without chicken because I'm a vegetarian and a side of spinach.  Our waitress was very nice but I asked for the spinach about 3 times before it actually did come out. I was disappointed in the spinach. It tasted okay but it was drenched in oil and served with Parmesan cheese on top of it with mushrooms and onions. Maybe they could have made it a little healthier before they killed the nutritional value of all the veggies.  The salad was pretty small. They served it in a bigger bowl but I would have liked to have more of everything.  So Friday's is a really hard place to order healthy in but I was trying my best because I'm working with my nutritionist. Sometimes I will indulge in what I want but I eat out too often to indulge all the time.

Awful service. Went to this location with my fiancé during his 1 hour lunch break. The waiter was terrible. We are stripes members and ordered chips and salsa and it never came. The waiter never acknowledged this. Finally 30 mins later out food finally came. The waiter never came to check up on us and my fiancé had to leave our table and go to another table to grab a ketchup bottle. We asked for then check which took another 10 mins to show up. We were waiting for our check to be picked up and 15 mins later the waiter still hadn't come back to our table. Frustrated we took back our credit card and instead left cash for the bill. Terrible experience and I will not be returning to this location. The one star is for the food being decent.

The restaurant itself isn't all that bad, but the clientele that they cater to are pretty shady. It's a bit like going to a restaurant in a lousy area of the Bronx, Latin Kings gang graffiti in the Mens Room, guys wearing gang paraphernalia, patrons getting pushy and impatient in the waiting area. It's a place where a member of the Crips would take their girlfriend on a Friday night. There will probably be a shooting one day in the near future.  It's a shame, it wasn't this way years ago when a more ethnically diverse crowd dined there. Friday's corp might want to shut this one down someday rather than be associated with any nasty incident that is likely to happen there someday.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had. Two of three orders were wrong ( one was for a serious allergy). Malik our waiter couldn't have been less at attentive if he tried. He didn't ask how our food was, didn't ask if we needed more to drink, brought us 1 glass for 2 beers, dropped off the bill didn't say thank you, but was very quick to pick it up. Will never return...

Where do I start, we walk in, get a seat immediately. We then proceed to wait for a waiter who strolls over eventually. Takes our drink order, we wait again......finally our water comes, no straws are given. We have to wait again for the waiter to come back to the table to get straws. Finally comes back, gives us straws. Waiter is ghost again. Then waiter finally reappears to take our order. Our order is brought out, everything is correct, grateful, wasn't sure with the waiter we had. Waiter is ghost again yet when we appears is ease dropping on our conversation because we hear him comment  waiter is ghost again.....we want our check, send a young lady over with not our check but another table who's already gone check and check card signature, finally comes over and doesn't apologize but makes some lame excuse about how he had to deal his other tables. The food was good but the device is HORRIBLE!!!!
Always a great time.  Prices are affordable. Employees are always nice. No complaints so far.

This was my 4th choice to eat.  My 1st choice was temporarily closed to my dismay and every other place had long waits and this one didn't (light-bulb!)  I really don't care for chain restaurants (except Cheesecake Factory) but we were hungry.   I understand high school and college kids work these jobs but more training and supervision should happen.  A half dozen "workers" or hostess are socializing at the door and nobody looks like they see customers.  Someone pushes another worker and she yells at them to stop pushing as she laughs and then seats us.  The waitress was much worst.  One minute after we were seated the waitress is taking our order before we picked up the menu.  That was the most attentive she was.  We waited to napkins, water, tartar sauce, and even to pay'!   I had to beg DH to tip at least the minimum.  I liked the drink I had however they make them too small and purposely have no prices near the drinks!  I didn't care for the appetizers but the shrimps were okay.  I can't say I won't be back because sometimes I'm out voted but I will probably go to another TGIF or ask for another waitress.

Went as group of 9 on a Thursday night after 7pm.  The good -we were seated right away.  Waiter seemed very new or wasn't paying attention when he was supposed to learn the menu.  My husband ordered the bruschetta chicken pasta which came out at least 5 mins before all of the other meals at the table.  When it arrived it was barely warm.  We finally got the waiter back after almost all the other food was delivered.  Husband sent back dish which was retuned to him after reheating and still wasn't hot.  Had to ask to see the manager who finally managed to offer a made fresh plate.  That one came out hot when most of the table had already finished their meals. The bill shows up and there was no compensation for bring the same food twice not heated properly.  Had to ask to get the meal taken off bill. Which they did but very disappointing service, food was passable.  Will not go here again or recommend it.
No complaints..Food was Good today..Service was appropriate.  Enjoyed this afternoon  lunch...they could add more salsa with chips and alcohol with drinks
Food and service was good. Prices are reasonable. Try the baby back jack Daniels rack of ribs.
First time have TIF food. Tried the traditional wings in ghost pepper flavor.  Truly hot but it s kind of chemical type of hot, not natural spicy.

So much for a quick lunch. I felt like a red headed step child as my server barely came to see me. Maybe because it was the lunch rush but there was not that many people in his section. He forgot about my drink and then forgot about my side salad as it came after my meal was done. Plus it took forever to complete this whole meal. Wanted so long in between points during. Also I feel like if you are not getting a burger or one of their highlight meals the food is literally just thrown the together. I have been to much better fast casual places. Sadly I can't say with certainty that I will return to this location.

Mozzarella sticks are great. If you are a part of their club, you get free chips and salsa while you are there. They are really good. The Cesar salad has quite a kick to it so it is not for me. The burger was great. The dessert is a Oreo ice cream cookie. The only thing is it isn't an ice cream cookie that you can pick up. You have to use a fork. The top and bottom are Oreo cookie crumb and the center is Oreo ice cream.

Gave this place another shot because we were in the neighborhood and hungry. Sunday 230 pm not crowded. The waiter was good but he had too many tables to handle. IF YOU LIKE YOUR FOOD COLD THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU.  Is it that hard to get a burger and fries delivered to the table hot??? It was tasty but frigging cold WTF. oh..the wings were well done as ordered and hot.  That's 50%. One more thing I'm close to 6ft tall. Why are the booths so high my feet dont reach the floor? Am I 6 years old or what. It will be a while before we come back.
No Go, I repeat, no go. food takes too long, understaffed. Food kinda gross but what do you expect i guess....I wont be back.

It never fails with this location. Everytime i call in to place a take out order i am left on hold for over 15 minutes. I work 3 blocks away so I drive over still on hold waiting to place in my ordee to show the manager that this is unacceptable. Roy's answer to me was "well it's kinda busy being Veterans Day and all"!! Wtf kind of answer is that?  This isn't the 1st time this has happened in the past 2 months.. What's your excuse for that?? Unapologetic with a smirk on his face he shrugs his shoulder and says "now that you're here I can have someone that your order".. Roy, take and add extra Jack Daniel sauce...!!!
I would give zero stars if I can....service stinks...DO NOT GO HERE!!...we were ignored totally...

Went to this place on a Saturday evening.  It was not busy.  There were no customers waiting to be seated.  We were not acknowledged by the front staff at all.  As a matter of fact, several employees were arguing in front of us.  One of them used extremely inappropriate language.  Finally,  we were seated.  We were waiting at out table for 10 minutes and a couple that sat next to us after we were seated got their drink orders first.  No one came.  We got up and left because no one acknowledged us at all.  We walked out and do you think any of the staff noticed or cared that we we're leaving in a huff?  No.  They're probably used to it.  I called to speak to the manager who never got on the line.  No thanks.   Never again

Service was very good had a nice waiter the problem for me was the overdone jack daniels chicken tenders. Also why are the booths so friggin high that your feet dont touch the floor???!!! Who came up with that stupid design? It is so uncomfortable for your feet to be hanging!

So my wife and I came here for lunch.   We were Met at door by young man who seated us.   He told us who our server was.  It took her about ten minutes to get to our table. The place was far from busy.   My wife ordered a coffee for her drink and when it arrived it was ice cold.    We complained. The waitress was apologetic but it took almost 30 min to get a new cup.  One girl took our order and brought us our coffee and soda.  Another girl gave us our food.   A third girl brought the second cup of coffee after we got the food.    My wife's dish was supposed to have chicken pepperoni and cheese and There was no pepperoni. We complained and the manager gave us free desert.  We ordered cheesecake.  It was disgusting.   But the check was ready before I asked for it.

I used to come here all the time.  Great atmosphere and it was the perfect hang out spot.  The bartenders and staff was always friendly.   Tonight ...it was ok, guess I'm hanging on to old memories...lol.  ordered a Barbados rum and it was ok, the spicy chicken is overrated...it's a chicken tender cut up on a buh with a drizzle of spicy sauce and a dab of Chipotle sauce.  Don't order this!

I went with my boyfriend who happened to be in a wheel chair at the time. The host didn't even help me by opening the door, I was literally struggling while he stood there waiting on us just watching. The services could of been better I get it they were busy but I put my drink order in as soon as the first one came out and I still sat there with an empty glass for at least 10min. Not to mention the food came out so cold I didn't even feel like complaining because it would of been an even longer wait. Not the best Fridays location just drive to the next one it'll be worth it.

Sat for 15 minutes before I finally got up to ask for assistance.  Finally another waitress stepped in until mine arrived. My waitress finally arrived and I placed an additional order but that never arrived until I waylaid the other waitress.   Manager would stand around looking stern but clearly not really paying much attention.

I always do at the bar because as soon there are always people waiting to be seated in front  but you usually find a seat at the bar when it's not too busy.  Why are people watching. When the is clearly plenty seats????  Thurs night is the real deal and you get a rib dinner for $11 but only on Thursdays. Dirty is one of the main bartenders there and not only is she friendly, but she looks out for you even when bar is super busy, and they are on Thursday nights. If I had to rate based on her alone it would be 5 stars. It seems strange to me, there were 2 couples waiting for a table, and we're left In waiting room, and there were plenty of tables available.  2nd time I saw this...the food is fine, comfort food. The multiple TV'S give you many sports there. It ls a nice   to chill.

I went to visit my family in NY and we decided to go to Friday's in westbury.  We were sat at a table that was filled with crumbs and floor was sticky, since it was a cramped corner for our party of 9, we described the problems and asked to be moved.  We were moved. I cannot even get involved with how many complaints I have about this visit because there are too many, but I will just tell you the main parts. Our side of fries was forgotten and my sister finished all of her food before they finally brought the fries out when we reminded them that they forgot.  My meat was very pink and I ordered well done. The two coronas that my mother ordered with the waiter, were never brought to us. We had to go to the bar to retrieve the drinks ourselves (two separate times!)   Then when I went to use the restroom, there were 3 stalls. 1 of them did not lock, 1 did not have toilet paper and the final stall had feces literally spread all over the seat and piled inside the bowl. I am immediately went and found somebody to address the issue, I apologized for being the bearer of bad news and the hostess said to me " it's OK, this happens on a weekly basis and I'm sure it's not nearly as bad as last week when I had to clean it". Then I saw a female employee come from the bathroom removing her dirty gloves As she passed a bunch of tables WITH PEOPLE EATING.  I wish I took a picture of the table with crumbs and the sticky floor but I didn't know it would be the least of my problems. But I do have an image of the toilet. All 9 of us (my family, my sisters family and my parents) are extremely disappointed and turned off by the filthy conditions, the employee removing shitty gloves near tables and our waiter who forgot our fries/our mothers beers and never came to give us refunds or ask us if our food was alright ( which Had the waiter ever asked me how my meal was I could have sent back my steak instead I had to throw it away) We then had to find him for our check Very upset. Very very disappointed for four weeks now I was told "Jess" from guest relations would get back to me and never has. Trust me, choose a different location to dine!

Wow. Tough night at Friday's. Waiter was a great guy but working against the stream. Ran out of endless mozzarella sticks after one order. Tried to make up with wings but never got em. Soup came as half a bowl with tons of garnish and sent back but waited 15 min to remedy. Forgive me but the manager should b canned. Never saw so many problems with a party of 6.  No mushrooms when the dish called for it and plenty of excuses. Again, great waiter but at the mercy of an incompetent kitchen. If anyone from Friday's reads this post, please take stock. Terrible and disappointing night. Waited forever for food. My daughter looked forward to eating endless mozz sticks and ran out?  That's pathetic. Never be back at this place again.

JUST THIS SERVICE So we get to restaurant and had to wait, no problem. Then we were seated w/menus 10-15 minutes later our server tell us the menu items were limited. She started naming a few unavailable items and told us they'll come to her as we order. All I could do was laugh in disbelief. So I ordered my food and asked if they had everything for my meal. She says yes, so I get my food and my order was  incomplete.  The people next to us had newborn twins. They were upset to have invested so much time settling in and looking at menu to find out NO FOOD! So they left as well.  It was just disappointing that the 1st time my baby sits in a high chair with no problem I had nothing to eat. Any other time I want to enjoy my food she won't allow me. I don't know...it can also be because she had nothing to grab off the table...smh.

From when you first walked in the door, the hostesses have attitudes on their faces No greeting or anything. Get to the table, place is half empty and didnt see a server for 15 minutes. Order drinks, warm water and drinks missing. Again, server is MIA. Never will go back and don't know how they stay open!

Absolutely horrendous service, took 30 minutes for the waitress to show up for drinks, then 20 minutes for just water... the ice was melted. Will never recommend Friday's to friends or family because of this place.

I honestly was disappointed in the service and lack of attentiveness by our Waiter Eddie, took him 20 minutes to get our drink order. Then the appetizers were given to us with no utensils,napkins or plates. I work in customer service and i have to say this was one of the worst experiences i have ever had. This was the first time i came to this location being that i just moved in the Area, I usually go to the Fridays in Manhasset where the service is always excellent. Such a shame but i will not be back here. I hope they begin training their staff to attend to their customers the way it should be done so.

This place has a disgusting hostess (some white girl).  Although our waitress was nice what turned me off with this place was the nasty ass hostess that sat us down.  Lucky for that "thing" we had a child with us that didn't need to hear us cursing or see us acting inappropriate.  She's the type that assume they can treat certain people in such a rude manner and think it's ok until they catch you at the wrong time & place.  Never ever had we experienced in a place such a ill mannered person.

First customers today at Friday's. Service was OK. Server vanished at times. I'm guessing she needed to support the staff out back or chit chat. Food was awful. Almost everything was cold or just like warm.  Had a much better experience coming in the late afternoons or evenings

This Friday's is totally renovated!! No more boring regular tables and chairs!! All the tables have these comfy soft red seats. Even the high top tables have comfy red cushion seats!!  Menu is the same except for the added "endless" app section.  Prices are reasonable for a restaurant like Friday's. They have all day drink specials. Speaking of all day drink specials, make sure you get charged the "special price" and not the regular price. I got charged $9 for a blue moon that was supposed to be $5. The manager correctly corrected it though.  If you're a stripes member, mention it to your server! You get free chips and salsa! For an extra $0.99 you can get guacamole and sour cream!

I have to say this place is so run down !! The booth we sat on smelled like urine. The bathroom had vomit all over the floor . I watched them clean the tables with the same dirty wet rag no cleaner after the whole table of kids were coughing all of it !! Dirty appetizer plate were given to us !! Food was horrible and not the same ! Do not eat at this location!'

Boy, this place has gone down hill. My friend and I came here for lunch today, and we were not happy. Dennis has their get more stripes card, but he left it at home. Our server asked if either of us had the card, and Dennis told him that he left it at home. Our server asked us if we wanted complimentary chips and salsa, to which we said no. He brought them anyway. I ordered my meal, and asked for Mashed Potatoes, and Fries, instead of the Broccoli. I have a hard time digesting Broccoli, which is why I asked for the fries instead. They brought me the Broccoli anyway. After we pointed this out, our server brought the mashed potatoes any way. The service was slow, it took over 45 minutes to get our food, and they were not that busy yet. Overall, it was not that great an experience. I think that I will stick with the TGI Fridays, in Manhasset instead.

It sucked Server was slower then molasses Order the unlimited appetizers it took 25 to 30 minutes between each order for it to come  Server said that lots of people were ordering appetizers so I asked him are a lot of people ordering the silverware because it took us 40 minutes to get ours  At the end of our meal we waited 25 minutes to get our check BTW I'm writing this as I'm here still waiting for my chance  Server was lost in never land, I'm sending out a search party looking for my change  S O S ......smoke signals didn't work  I think I lost my money twice today.

Waited forever for our drinks, and when we did get it, you couldn't taste ANY alcohol! When the manager came over to speak to us, she claimed we're not suppose to taste the alcohol but we had ordered the same drinks before that were much better tasting!!! She allowed us to order a new drink, but they were still horrible! We waited forever for our endless refills on the appetizer and they came out on very small sampler plates that lasted for 1 min between 4 people. I do NOT recommend this place at all! Save your time!!!!! Service, food and drinks suck here!
Djs on Fridays distracts the employees. No Bueno. Took our waiter 30 mins to give me water on ice. Im a frequent customer on the weekdays but today. Smh today was a disappointment

This Friday's was very clean , fast service , and friendly workers ! Not too overly in your face , but just enough to get refills on your drinks if you need them .  They brought out the kids food first , very fast service and my kids LOVED their food . My son got chicken fingers and fries , perfectly cooked . My daughter got the pasta with butter and fries , again a perfectly cooked meal .  I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp , very yummy and sizzling ! Lol . It was just the right portion and cooked  wonderfully . My husband ordered a burger (not sure what name ) he said was very delicious!  The prices seemed to go up a little bit I'm sure that's all Friday restaurants. We also got the "new" spinach and artichoke dip , it's a smaller portion of the dip part , but they added more chips , guacamole and salsa .  Over all I was pleased with the food and service , our waitress was friendly , especially to the children

I have been here many times but this will be my LAST.  I was greeted so nice upon entering but that all went down hill at the bar. The bartender/barista was unattentive. I don't know if she was just overwhelmed but we waited awhile for service. We almost got up and left (btw she would have never noticed and  looked like others did the same) but I didn't want to be that person. She seemed more engaged with the guys around the bar but not the couples including us. Then she disappeared and I had to grab some other person to order more drinks and food. Both were not rude or mean but nonchalant about their job. I'm not trying to get anyone in trouble but apparently this location has a huge turnover in staff and it showed in service. Too many other establishments in the area to deal with mediocre service. I'm not on a desktop because if I was I'd give it a half star.

The food was so cold . Tasted like microwave food .. my fries were soggy everything was horrible.. first of all they took at least 25 minute to come to our table . The place wasn't even that busy  . Worst experience

Came here for Mothers Day dinner and it was a nightmare. Two stars because the 1st round of drinks and the appetizers were good.  After that it all went down hill. Our waitress took our order and didn't come back until the food was ready, I had to get up and walk around to find someone to give me a simple straw since she never came back with one. The food wasn't cooked properly, I couldn't even get it fixed since NO ONE CAME TO ASK IF EVERYTHING WAS OK.   I got up to find her and asked for management. The manager, Nick, came around and offered a free desert. I sent my meal back and they didn't offer to replace it. I'm infuriated. And to top it off. The babys high hair was broken.  And none of the high chairs here have seat belts, he nearly fell out head 1st.   STAY AWAY.  HAPPY MOTHERS DAY to me ‍‍

Came here on a Tuesday afternoon, not the most popular time for customers, and the service was efficient and very friendly! My friends ordered endless apps and I got coffee, the new endless apps variety is very good - but those garlic Parmesan wings are heavenly. The new meatballs are also quite good as well as the fried pickles, they are highly addictive. The BBQ chicken flatbread is very lackluster in my opinion, but you might as well try it too because it's endless apps lol. Nice bathrooms and excellent waiters, if you sign up for the membership online, you can also get a free coupon for an appetizer or dessert. Definitely come for having fun with friends!

If zero was a option then that's what it would be. This has to be the worst TGI Fridays in all of NYC I will never ever go to this hell hole again the food comes out cold and the manager is just as nasty as her staff was. One guy especially don't go and see his name is Scott and he sucks at his job

Tonight's service was absolutely terrible. They forgot my soda after I asked twice. Food took very long. My waitress also had an attitude because I asked for my soda... twice. I wouldn't of had to ask again if you brought it to me 25 minutes earlier. I go to Fridays at least once month and I have never had terrible service like tonight.

Lunch: place is not remotely busy.  Party size: 5 Ordered at 1:15 pm (approx) Food received: 2:10 pm (approx) Food was cold, orders were not correct. Server never refilled drinks. Ridiculous mess of a visit.

Came here for lunch, the place was mostly empty. Took nearly an hour to get food after ordering. 5 orders, 1 salad, 1 chicken tenders, 1 Jack Daniels chicken sandwich, 1 turkey burger, and 1 bruachetta pasta. Food was brought to the table cold and incorrect. Server never offered to refill drinks. Very disappointed.

Though this Friday's is in a great location highly advise that you stay away from this establishment UNTIL they improve their services. First and foremost.....the staff needs to be re-trained on keeping any frustration or issues they are having with fellow employees behind closed doors. Second of all......the wait time for food needs to definitely be worked on. We waited for appetizers - simple appetizers at that - for an hour plus. The only reason we did not leave is because we were enjoying our drinks, hence the one star. What did it for me though, was that after that hour plus wait for the food.......the food came out cold. That is 100% unacceptable in my eyes after waiting all that time. I asked the manager to comp the food and told her that we would pay and tip for our drinks. She respected my request and I hope that she truly analyzes the feedback I provided her with.
Food good. Beer cold. Service at the bar very very slow 4 visits in a row while staying at the hotel next store. Unfortunate.

Our waiter Anthony needs to be retrained.   He takes to long to go and come back to the table.   Then he forgets what he is suppose  to bring you.  He bought our food and my son had ordered a side of shrimp which he bought to the table 10 minutes later. He takes our check then goes to another table and takes their order.  Do not think I will going back there anytime soon.

Came here very late on a Friday (how appropriate) for some drinks and apps. The hostesses weren't enthusiastic about seating us.  I guess because it was close to closing time. The place kind of looked a mess. Lots of tables full of garbage, just begging to be cleaned. Our waitress was great though. I believe her name was Vicky?  There was also live music, which we were told was a new thing they were trying out. The girl singing was amazing and it was a nice change to hear someone perform live. Anyways, a TGIFridays is not my favorite place to go out to eat but it's not so bad for drinks with friends!

I wanted to write to you because this is the second negative experience I have had at this establishment. 2 years ago I had a horrible experience but I made the mistake of giving Fridays another chance. Let me explain my experience, walk in to an empty restaurant and was told I had to wait 10-15 minutes for a table, it took the waitress another 20 minutes to come to the table at which time we asked for water that never came. We eventually got the attention of a girl wiping down tables and asked her for water . We did finally get water 25 minutes later. Our waitress finally came with a horrible attitude, the plates from the appetizers were never cleared and our main dish was served leaving very little room on the table. The waitress never smiled the few times  we did see her which wasn't very often. I work in a profession that requires my staff to uphold values of providing excellent customer service. It seems that Fridays does not uphold these same values, and it is not getting any better with time. If  I could I would give it no stars. Its not worth your time or money!

Went there last night for my sons birthday dinner. The apps were slow to arrive. The wings were over fried with some sauce thrown over it. My husband ordered an 8oz steak, it came out dry and over done looked more like 4oz. My older one ordered half rack ribs they were dry like yesterday's chicken. I ordered the salmon which was totally flavorless and randomly seasoned. Even my French onion soup was bad... How does one screw up FOsoup?? Anyways, will not be going here again!

This restaurant did not have items clearly on the menu. Not food sensitive friendly. I didn't want red onions, and I got red onions. I wanted my steak well done, and it was really burned on the outside and pink on the inside. I was supposed to get an "aged cheese plate," and I got bleu cheese. Not only was my order wrong, but it took forever to come out. To top it off, the ordering app waiter's use is incredibly inefficient, so this awful stay was unnecessarily prolonged. I've always enjoyed going to Friday's, but this experience has made me never want to step foot in one again. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

9,18.17. TGI. Friday's, Westbury, NY.  Broken TV Alert!!.. Most of The Bat TVs are broken here..?? Happy  Monday night football everyone!   Hey Monday is Great time to go to Friday's. I need a cold Beer! I chose to sit at the bar today, I like sitting at the bar because service is usually pretty quick.  That is not the case here at this Friday's on my 4th visit here. I still was not immediately acknowledged at the bar, in fact a good 10 minutes passed as the barmaids did not even contact my eyes.  I noticed immediately that the service staff seemed overwhelmed with the volume of customers tonight. I had not been greeted yet and decided I would help myself to a menu. This seems to be a disconnect here between the staff and the patrons. After another 10 minutes no one had acknowledged me yet, I decided it was time to clean off the bar in front of me, to wipe away the crumbs. The barmaid was straightening and maintaining the bar in front of me, I finally had to said  "Hello" myself.  Looked up  I noticed half of the TVs surrounding the bar were  Turned off and or Broken?!!   Come on guys ?? This is Monday night football!  I was just in another  bar with over 100 big screen televisions. This is Totally inexcusable and unacceptable for Monday night football.  Or "Any" Bar, that would be open.  I asked about Monday night football specials, there either were not any, or the barmaid did not know.  In a saving grace they did have $5 Octoberfest On tap.. The  Barmaid did not even know what kind?!   There were not any runners bringing the food out with the exception of the poor overworked manager.  As a result some of the food was coming out cold as the barmaids themselves had to go down and get the food from the kitchen.  My spare rib dinner was not bubbling hot and my fries were ice cold.  My barmaid was kind enough to bring me another order of fries but with no food runners these also were not piping hot.  The manager and barmaid tried as best as they could,  but they are totally Understaffed here. A decision corporate makes to save money at the expense of the customers.  I hate giving any place A 2  Star rating,  but how can you even open your bar with most of your televisions broken.  There are literally a 100 eating establishments in a 5-mile mile radius in this Westbury and Garden City area, offering incredible, fabulous Dining experiences.  I am still a fan of Friday's, but unfortunately with the skeleton crew of employees here and broken TV's, I won't be returning here for a while.  Who would?? JIM D.
Delivery was wrong TWICE in ONE night.  The first time they completely gave me the wrong food.  The second time they didn't include half of my order.  This place blows.  Don't order.

Came with my family last night, and even went so far as to reserve a table online to ensure no wait.  It was not as busy as one would think on a Saturday night, and we were seated right away.  Our server came, and was attentive.  Things were looking great... Then we ordered three drinks.  Coke for me, sangria for the wife, and water for our child.  Everything but the water came. Ordered one endless app, the spinach dip and two entrees.  Everything but the dip came.  No explanation.  No followup. I thought it was sign that perhaps it wasn't necessary.  I will admit, I was bit irritated by the mishaps.  What got me was that the server was annoyed at me being irritated, as though this were my fault somehow.  I asked for the check and a to go container for the entree that we didn't finish.  The check came (incorrect amount), and no to go container. Asked him once again for the container, he said "I'll take care of it."  Came back with a container (no bag to put it in), and one more round of the endless appetizer, but had it placed slightly off the table, that one misplaced hand gesture sends it to the floor... The only saving graces were that the food was good, the restaurant was clean overall, and the manager did take care of the bill.  Dunno if it was the server, the night, or what.  But I hope your experience at this Fridays should you go is better than mine.

This is the absolute worst TGIF restaurant I've been to. Customer service is at an all time low.   We waited to be seated although there were numerous seats available.  Once seated we waited 15 minutes to witness waiters/waitresses approach and tend to 4 tables of people, who were seated after us. When we requested to speak to the manager,  we were blown off and told he was at a table. This information came from the 3 employees who were standing in the front of the restaurant doing absolutely nothing.  The manager was no help at all. His solution was to ask if we were staying or going. Ummmmmm, we'll be leaving. Very low standards and unprofessional children as employees. I'm disgusted!!!!

I've gotten sick here twice despite ordering different meals so not sure what it was that caused it. It's super cold and has a wet dish towel smell to it for some reason. Staff is a hit or miss and food is good but so salty and you feel gross after eating it. Honestly they only reason I come is for the brownie obsession I eat once a year
Service is lovely. A group of sweethearts working there. But the food. I guess I went on the wrong day or ordered the wrong meal.

Tonight I dined at the tgi Fridays in westbury. I had justin as my waiter and had to say that He was very attentive and kind. He was on the ball the whole night. Looking forward to coming back thanks to him!

Don't even deserve one star . Waitress was not helpful with the menu at all. To much attitude not friendly at all.  I'm  was there with my friends . My friends order unlimited apps but got one time server at the table . On top of that snack portions are so small what are you expecting a person to eat . Makes no sense not at all. But then manger came n took the app off from the cheq which is a courtesy I appreciate it. But don't have things on menu which can't be served on proper time Bc appetite means something.

If i could give 0 stars i would. This place is ridiculous. I came here today same day as this post a Wednesday. The place is practically empty and i have a party of 13. The waitress cant remember her name only checked on us because i called the restaurant and had a manager come to us. Were pressed for time trying to catch a nets game at the collisium. It took 30 minutes to get drinks mind you 4 of those drinks are waters. We all order endless apps and each app has taken 20 to 25 minutes to get. The place is empty doesnt make sense and the manager made up a bs excuse for the reason for it. The service here was horrible and i go to many fridays worked at a applebees before and never seen this before. Im not one to write horrible reviews but this is out of hand. Im not gunna say not to go here but if you do please prepare for shit service

Like all the chain stores. We ate a hamburger that was only reasonable. The place is quite sticky and not clean. But the waiter named Randall was excellent and very pleasant, so it was only because of him that the experience at the place was reasonable

I was really not impressed by TGI Fridays.  The bright points in the visit were how pleasant our waiter was, really nice guy, and that no one got food poisoning.  The restaurant needs a thorough cleaning. There was a smell at the entrance. The table was cleaned but not thoroughly and needed to be wiped down again, my husband's menu was full of sticky gunk (see pic) and the bathroom floor left a lot to be desired.  The food was ok. The burgers and fries were ok, not bad, but I the burgers at the shake shack down the road are much better. The potato skins were really lackluster. Didn't taste fresh made.

That Bucket of Bones was on point along with the Mule! The thing that was great about the experience was the outstanding service given by Nia! Not only was she super attentive, but she didn't mind my indecisiveness nor my having her run back and forth! If you ever find yourself at Friday's in Westbury on. Sunday night, ask for Nia! She will make a good experience awesome!!!

Wow !! What service ! I had the pleasure of being served by Justin after a 5 hour gre exam in the building next door. Entered the building tired and frustrated from my long day and ended up leaving laughing and satisfied- with all the intentions of coming back again! He was quick, attentive and friendly. So glad i choose tgi fridays :)  **also if you get the beer cheese and pretzel app make sure to ask for extra cheese
I came to fridays to have a late night snack and was told if I wasn't on the list they were closed it was 1130pm and they close at 2 on a Saturday  Will never come to this location again

I ordered my usual grilled salmon with lemon butter broccoli and French fries with a side of cheddar Mac & cheese (second time trying) for take out. To be honest, that was the driest salmon I ever had, didn't have any type of flavor. I live 7 mins away from this location no way my fries should of been that cold by the time I got home. To end, the cheddar Mac & cheese tasted like it was microwaved. I'm disappointed folks.

my co-workers and I placed an online order. when we got there to pick it up the order wasn't ready and mind you they gave us a time of pick. They staff was't friendly at all, we ended up waiting 15 mins to get our food. got back to the office and the order was completely wrong. We had to pay extra for our sides and we did not get it they gave us all fries with our burgers. Very disappointment

SUCKS!!! Wish I could give negative stars.  Miserable individuals working there. Not one smile in the place.  Was seated for 20 minutes without one person asking if we'd like a drink. Place is crap. Should turn it into an Applebee's!! We walked out and went down the road to Houlihan's where they greeted us with a smile and served right away. The way service is supposed to be.

After my complaint here and on their website, I received a call from their General Manager. The details are below. Still waiting for them to take care of their end. I will keep U posted: "This is a follow up to my initial complaint regarding events that took place on this day. After filing my first complaint regarding your server giving me a beef patty after my wife and I specifically advised we were vegetarian and wanted a well done black bean burger (which we had at your establishment before), I received a call from someone identifying herself as the General Manager. I gave her details about the incident and included something I did not write after my first contact, that the waitress gave us tortilla chips that had half eaten chicken in them. Now this might be heresay, however I took a picture of the item and it now resides on yelp.  The General Manager listened to this and apologized profusely and said she was going to send me a gift card to make up for it. I advised her that it should be sent to my wife and that we would come during the day because I really didn't want to see that server again because I am allergic to beef and didn't want her serving us. She verified my email address and since then, I have heard nothing.  This is not good follow up, especially since this was an incident that could have devolved into a legal battle. This feels like exact what I mentioned to the General Manager: Lack of attention to detail. Except this lack of detail is now coming directly from her.  I want to make you aware of this before I decide how I will respond to this situation. I want to be clear: as I stressed to her, I am VERY upset about this and feel something should be done. It is my hope that you feel the same way.  Thank you. "

My 1st time dining at this place. I eat at any tgi bc their foods are delicious. I rated 3 stars bc it took what seemed like almost more than half an hour to get our food and when we Finally got our food, it was disgustingly cold. They were short staff. Waitress  was good.  Floors needed to be cleaned. The place ran out of popular appetizers- granted it was a holiday season. I'd still go here again - Bc It's Friday's !
It's an ok place I enjoyed coming here the staff was friendly and accommodating.  Didnt have to wait long. Food was hot and good I was pleasantly surprised
